Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model
Updated schema version. LIDVID references updated to be LID references. Adding missing "investigation" references. Adding missing "agency" references. Description updated.

External_Reference.reference_text: Gladstone, G.R., S.C. Persyn, J.S. Eterno, B.C. Walther, D.C. Slater, M.W. Davis, M.H. Versteeg, K.B. Persson, M.K. Young, G.J. Dirks, A.O. Sawka, J. Tumlinson, H. Sykes, J. Beshears, C.L. Rhoad, J.P. Cravens, G.S. Winters, R.A. Klar, W. Lockhart, B.M. Piepgrass, T.K. Greathouse, B.J. Trantham, P.M. Wilcox, and M.W. Jackson, The Ultraviolet Spectrograph on NASA's Juno Mission, Space Science Reviews, doi:10.1007/s11214-014-0040-z, 2014.

Instrument.name: ULTRAVIOLET SPECTROGRAPH
Instrument.description: The long-slit Ultraviolet Imaging Spectrograph (UVS), with a spectral range of 68-210 nanometers and spectral resolution of 0.6-1.2 nanometers, was designed to observe and characterize important H2 and H Lyman series emissions from Jupiterâ€™s aurora and absorption signatures of aurora-produced hydrocarbons.
